author: Deleted User
content:
Hey folks. I've been reading on all the requirements for running a validator on eth2, and noticed this on https://launchpad.ethereum.org/checklist

```
For example, you need at least 140 GB SSD to run geth fast sync on mainnet.
```

---

AFAICT you must be running an ETH1 node (for example Geth), and Geth definitely takes much more than 140 GB SSD. A new node takes around 290 GB... and only grows from there on... how does one run a Geth node today with just 140GB SSD? Maybe I am missing something?
